definition: nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods

sentences.english: I afforded your trip but you rendered my son so much trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我出錢，還讓我兒子受了這麼多的窩囊氣。

sentences.english: He searched for a lover for his wife after he became paralyzed, is he a wretch or a true man?
sentences.chinese: 癱瘓後，他爲他的妻子找情人，是窩囊廢還是純爺們？

sentences.english: After all, we're a  cowardly nation. We've long had a cowardly government.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，我們是個窩囊的國家，一直就有個窩囊政府。

sentences.english: After all, we're a  cowardly nation. We've long had a cowardly government.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，我們是個窩囊的國家，一直就有個窩囊政府。

sentences.english: "I'm goin' to quit, " he announced. "I won't stand for it.
sentences.chinese: “我不幹了，”他宣佈，“受不了這種窩囊氣。

sentences.english: No money, the somebody else scold you are wimps.
sentences.chinese: 沒有錢，人家罵你是窩囊廢。

sentences.english: Can you believe it? That pathetic loser stoled my story.
sentences.chinese: 你能想象嗎？那個可悲的窩囊廢偷用了我的故事。

sentences.english: He is really a worthless wretch.
Lino is the head of a dangerous family. There isn't room for wimps in this family.
sentences.chinese: 李諾是黑幫家族首腦，這家庭裏容不下窩囊廢。

sentences.english: By contrast those seen as wimpiersorts will have longer index fingers.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，那些被認爲較窩囊的男人食指則更長。

sentences.english: Mike was the good-for-nothing son in Smith and Son Construction.
sentences.chinese: 邁克是史密斯與兒子建築公司裏阿誰窩囊廢兒子。

sentences.english: She has more pride than the wimpless guy.
sentences.chinese: 她比那窩囊傢伙更得意。

sentences.english: A flimflam man, matchstick man, loser.
sentences.chinese: 花言巧語的傢伙，火柴人，窩囊廢。
那就證明我是個窩囊廢。

sentences.english: A shame to let a joker like this win.
sentences.chinese: 讓這麼一個窩囊廢贏了真丟醜。

sentences.english: The man is absolutely a loser.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩是個徹頭徹尾的窩囊廢。

definition: to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
